gtm_prompt: Help me prepare for my QBR
reasoning:
- 'QBR' = Quarterly Business Review (business review meeting)
- Ambiguous - could be sales forecast OR customer health review
- Assuming sales_rep context (most common individual contributor QBR)
- Forecast_review intent - sales rep reviewing account growth
- Expansion motion - QBR with customers focuses on growth
- Existing scope - QBRs are with current customers
- This quarter time horizon - quarterly cadence
- Should use company_fai (departmental opportunities), company_firmographic (account context), company_intent (expansion signals)
- Should NOT use company_search (not prospecting, reviewing existing accounts)
- Should NOT use product research (internal account review)

- 'QBR' = Quarterly Business Review for specific account
- Named account indicates customer health review (not forecast)
- Engagement_summary intent - reviewing account activity and health
- Renewal motion - ensuring customer satisfaction and retention
- CS role assumed - CSMs own customer QBRs
- Existing scope - Acme is current customer
- This quarter time horizon - quarterly review cycle
- Should use company_intent (engagement signals), company_technographic (product adoption), company_fai (departmental usage)
- Should NOT use company_search (single account prep, not search)
- Should NOT use product reviews (internal review, not external)

assumptions_applied: Named account QBR = CS health review
